Subject: Welcome and overview of the conference

Subject: INN: Welcome
Description: Speakers:  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2013/

Subject: Merchants of mudslinging
Description: Speakers: Michael Beckel, Julie Bykowicz, Robert Faturechi - Here’s one prediction about the 2016 election that’s guaranteed to be true: There will be attack ads, lots of attack ads. Who is behind these ads, however, is not always clear. Panelists will offer tips on how to investigate any and all groups that pop up and start running political ads. They will also outline how to examine the consultants who are cashing in and making big bucks — regardless of their candidates winning or losing. Put these practices to use while covering any election, from dogcatcher to president. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1898/

Subject: Digging into data for stories: A crash course (pre-registration required)
Description: Speakers: Jaimi Dowdell, Megan Luther - Even if you’ve never touched a spreadsheet, you will walk away from this daylong workshop able to use Excel for your next investigation. You’ll come away with plenty of story ideas and also learn about publicly available databases that you can download and analyze to produce great local stories. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1891/

Subject: INN: Best practices in nonprofit news -  The latest on how to fund your content
Description: Speakers: Lisa Williams - **Moderated by Lisa Williams, Institute for Nonprofit News | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1940/

Subject: Interactive data graphics in Tableau Public (Hosted by Tableau)
Description: Learn how to create beautiful, interactive data visualizations on short deadlines. No programming required. You'll learn everything you need to build data visualizations and publish them to your website just like a video.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2076/

Subject: Broadcast: What does the audience want?
Description: Speakers: Graeme Newell - How does your newsroom pick investigation topics? In most newsrooms, this important decision is based solely on the hunch of a reporter. Too often, this strategy leads to poor ratings when we create investigations that newsrooms love, but viewers hate. Viewer researcher Graeme Newell reveals the results of a comprehensive study. You’ll learn the topics and storytelling techniques that drive ratings. He’ll reveal the hopes, worries and frustrations that affect viewers the most and you’ll learn how to drive ratings by putting the viewers’ priorities at the center of your storytelling process. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1925/

Subject: The year in CAR
Description: Speakers: Megan Luther, Alex Richards - What were the big stories of the year? What were the most creative uses of data analysis? See what your colleagues have been up to and pick up some story ideas at the same time. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1894/

Subject: Show & Tell (Thursday - #1)
Description: Speakers: Brad Stone - Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2060/

Subject: Reporting on the security state in your own community
Description: Speakers: Trevor Aaronson, Mark Hosenball, Kate Martin, Tara McKelvey | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1897/

Subject: Analytics to find and grow your audience, from the reporter's perspective (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Rachael Delgado, Benjamin Herold - Working journalists are increasingly responsible not just for reporting the news, but for making sure readers can find and engage with our work online and via social media. Newsrooms have more data than ever to help us fulfill these new responsibilities, and there has been a flourishing of new ideas and digital tools aimed at helping us better use that information. But a big disconnect remains. How can everyday reporters keep up with all the changes, without making ourselves miserable? Education Week staff writer Benjamin Herold and Director of Knowledge Services Rachael Delgado will share their process for using analytics to grow the readership of Ed Week's Digital Education blog by more than 90% - and produce smarter, more timely content in the process.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2112/

Subject: Finding the story: Census
Description: Speakers: Paul Overberg - We’ll start with a typical journalistic frame: Post-recession, your community faces heavy social strain. How do you tell that story in new ways, accurately, in context, out through the ripples? We’ll work through critical prep, then how to get and interview the data. To get the most from this session, you should have some experience working with data in spreadsheets. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2032/

Subject: Legal, technical, and policy challenges facing journalists: A primer and path forward
Description: Speakers: Hannah Bloch-Wehba, Jennifer Henrichsen, Sara Rafsky - Mass state surveillance and digital security practices have been increasingly in the news since the Snowden revelations began in mid-2013, yet the legal, technical, and policy aspects of these revelations and their implications for journalists striving to protect their communications and their sources remains complex and convoluted. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1893/

Subject: On The beat: Business (Sponsored by Bloomberg)
Description: Speakers: Brian Fechtel, Cary Spivak, Jason Zweig, Daniel Gilbert - **Moderated by Daniel Gilbert, The Wall Street Journal | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2029/

Description: Speakers: Lena Groeger | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2033/

Description: **Moderated by Laura Frank, Rocky Mountain PBS | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2116/

Description: Speakers: Samantha Sunne, Matt Wynn | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2003/

Subject: Covering policing, from shootings to community relations (Sponsored by Criminal Justice Journalists)

Subject: What the hell is R and all the other questions you're afraid to ask
Description: Speakers: Tisha Thompson, Sisi Wei | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1900/

Subject: Broadcast: Interviews that work
Description: Speakers: Wendy Halloran, Tony Kovaleski, Noah Pransky | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1901/

Subject: How to sort out science for your investigation
Description: Speakers: Jeff Donn, Jon Kamp, Kendall Taggart, Ellen Gabler - **Moderated by Ellen Gabler, Milwaukee Journal Sentinel | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1902/

Subject: The right to photograph & record in public: On the ground & in the air
Description: Speakers: Mickey Osterreicher - Ever since 911 there has been a heightened awareness of anyone taking pictures or recording events in public. This issue has only been exacerbated by the widespread proliferation of cellphone cameras and the ability of everyone to post photos and recordings on the Internet, where they may be viewed and shared. Video recordings of police have played an integral role in many recent news stories, but questions still remain about the rights of citizens and journalists to photograph and record in public. This session will examine constitutional issues, search and seizure, exigent circumstances, and qualified immunity as well as provide practical advice regarding the best ways to handle these situations. There will also be discussion of privacy concerns, police bodycams and the latest legal updates on use of drones for newsgathering. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1903/

Subject: Advanced design and interaction in Tableau Public (Hosted by Tableau)
Description: Analyzing data and coming up interactive visualizations is easy in Tableau but sometimes getting everything looking polished isn’t. In this session you will learn how to break away from the default formatting in Tableau Public to create interactive data graphics that match your style guides and engage your readers.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2077/

Subject: Consumer investigations
Description: Speakers: Jim Donovan, Cindy Galli, Randy Mac - It’s the news everyone can use. Consumer investigations give your viewers and readers high value when we take special interest in their safety and their wallets. So how do we make them unique? This panel will take you through best practices to organize, wade through and advance consumer investigations. We’ll talk laws, finding sources, and backgrounding and approaching businesses. Plenty of links and story ideas, too. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1896/

Subject: Uncovering fraud and malfeasance
Description: Speakers: Angela Couloumbis, Craig McCoy, Michael LaForgia, Brooke Williams, David Cay Johnston - **Moderated by David Cay Johnston, Newsweek | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2099/

Subject: Mobile ready visualizations with Silk (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Alex Salkever - Silk is an all-purpose tool for data journalism that lets anyone convert spreadsheets into an online database and data visualizations in minutes. In this demo session, we'll pull data about 2015 killings by the police in California, aggregated from Facebook, and turn it into maps, charts, and interactive tables. Then, we'll upload data from the 500 most successful Kickstarter technology projects in 2014, do some quick visual analysis, save and publish visualizations. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1909/

Subject: On the beat: Criminal justice
Description: Speakers: Kelvyn Anderson, Alec Klein, Cheryl W. Thompson, John Sullivan - **Moderated by John Sullivan, The Washington Post | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1906/

Subject: A conversation with Seymour Hersh
Description: Speakers: Seymour Hersh, Leonard Downie, Jr - **Moderated by Leonard Downie, Jr., ASU Walter Cronkite School of Journalism | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1905/

Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2062/

Subject: Designing database applications to increase page views and ad revenues
Description: Speakers: Edward Garcia - With journalists facing increasing pressure to create data interactives that engage more readers, it’s important to optimize data-driven applications for interactivity, traffic and page views. Learn how to design and deploy revenue-generating applications that will continue to serve as long-lasting data assets. This demo will showcase real-world examples and techniques for building “share-worthy” hyper-local applications. Technologies covered: Caspio, Google maps, GPS and location proximity, AJAX, CDN, data feeds, SEO, and cross-channel deployment (web, mobile and social). | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2034/

Description: -Measuring metrics: What really tells the story of your audience and impactA discussion of the many different ways to measure impact both qualitatively and quantitatively. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2120/

Subject: 50 Apps in 30 Minutes (plus 30 minutes of other cool mobile stuff)
Description: Speakers: David Ho - Supercharge your smartphone for reporting! Can't stand the idea of being without your phone? Then you can't be without this session. WSJ's executive mobile editor will help you turn your phone into a Swiss Army Knife of journalism goodness with this always-updating and fun session on apps and tools for gathering and producing news. Want to use your phone to record interviews? Take better notes? Transcribe audio? Edit video? Track Tweets? Talk on camera? ID airplanes? Translate Swahili? There's an app for that. Plus, learn about more tips, tricks and mobile gear. The mobile age is here. You should be here, too. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1915/

Description: Speakers: Bonnie Raines, John Raines, James Steele, Betty Medsger, Johanna Hamilton, Keith Forsyth - **Moderated by James Steele, Vanity Fair | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1916/

Description: Speakers: Skylar Olsen - Housing data is about more than just real estate. Subject: Best of broadcast
Description: Speakers: Tisha Thompson - Watch and listen as the photographers, editors and producers behind this year’s IRE Award winners and finalists explain how they did it, what they would do differently and what they were really thinking when things got hard. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1953/

Subject: Power couple: Data-driven reporting and people-driven narrative
Description: Speakers: Audra Burch, Michael Sallah, Steven Rich, Deborah Nelson, Carol Marbin Miller - **Moderated by Deborah Nelson, University of Maryland | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1924/

Subject: Access to your information: Subpoenas, shield laws and more
Description: Speakers: Amy Ginensky, Gregg Leslie, Mickey Osterreicher, Maud Beelman - **Moderated by Maud Beelman, The Associated Press | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2097/

Subject: Banjo: Report the news first (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Jennifer Peck - In today’s world, events are captured by over 7 billion cell phones. Combine mobile access with social sharing and everyone becomes a reporter. Nearly every story is reported first by social media users. Banjo alerts you to these stories, but when breaking news happens, an alert is not enough. Banjo gives you the fastest way to get “eyes on the ground.” We show you everything that is happening from the people who are actually there, in real time, across all social networks. You’ll be reporting the news as it unfolds with eyewitness sources. With Banjo, you’ll turn signals into stories and get news out before anyone else. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1928/

Subject: How reporters can best protect themselves and their sources
Description: Speakers: Ross Garber, Adam Goldman, Joel Kurtzberg, Mark MacDougall - How do you know if your story might trigger a lawsuit or a leak investigation? Should you keep your notes or throw them out? How much do you tell your editors? Your colleagues? What are best email practices? Do you know what is privilege and who owns it? Hear from top defense lawyers and a Pulitzer-Prize winning investigative reporter who have been embroiled in these toxic investigations.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1937/

Subject: Under pressure: Real life in real time with breaking news
Description: Speakers: Stephen Stock | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2021/

Subject: Getting data into Excel
Description: Speakers: Patti DiVincenzo - Don't let hard-to-use data ruin your day. Learn how to import a variety of formats (such as text files, HTML tables, PDFs) into Excel. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2014/

Subject: Finding the story: Bridge inspections
Description: Speakers: Liz Lucas | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2022/

Subject: Investigating the justice system (Sponsored by Criminal Justice Journalists)
Description: Speakers: John Hollway, Beth Hundsdorfer, George Pawlaczyk, John Roman, Douglas Starr, Ted Gest - **Moderated by Ted Gest, Criminal Justice Journalists | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1931/

Subject: Broadcast: Visual video toolbox
Description: Speakers: Jeremy Jojola, Bryan Staples, Evan Stulberger | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1954/

Subject: Show & Tell (Friday - #3)
Description: Speakers: Kevin Keeshan - Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2067/

Subject: Sexual assault investigations: Empathy, accuracy, transparency (Sponsored by Dart Center for Journalism & Trauma)
Description: Speakers: Teresa Braeckel, Sheila Coronel, Steve Coll, Elana Newman, Nicole Noren, Bruce Shapiro - **Moderated by Bruce Shapiro, Dart Center for Journalism & Trauma | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1989/

Subject: Open records laws: Strategies for successful negotiations
Description: Speakers: Hannah Levintova, Joshua B. Pribanic | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2100/

Subject: Adventures in the oil patch: Fracking, earthquakes and corporate influence
Description: Speakers: Ziva Branstetter, Lisa Song, Mike Soraghan - Join us for a wide-ranging discussion on watchdog stories you can do in your state tracking the influence and impact of the energy industry. We'll tell you how to report on induced earthquakes, spills, oilfield safety, pollution, weak regulation and corporate influence involving oil and gas operations. Whether you live in an oil or gas producing state or not, your readers and viewers are impacted by these issues and we'll tell you how to frame them.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1943/

Subject: Muckraking around the world
Description: Speakers: Dayo Aiyetan, Wahyu Dhyatmika, Jan Gunnar Furuly, Rana Sabbagh, David Kaplan - **Moderated by David Kaplan, Global Investigative Journalism Network | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1976/

Subject: Ethnography for journalists: Storytelling and the deep dive
Description: Speakers: Sarah Stillman, Paige Williams | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1938/

Subject: Internet site fingerprints: Looking for telltale signs that suggest connections between websites (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Griff Palmer - A company presenting itself as a legitimate, global corporate citizen has been described to you by former insiders as an Internet fraud scheme. The former insiders have identified several Web sites that they say are part of the scheme, and have given you rock-solid evidence. Your sources tell you their confirmed sites are part of a much larger network. The company allegedly behind it all has a history of litigiousness, and has gone to great lengths to cover up its alleged ties to the fraudulent network. Griff Palmer will show how widely available Internet tools can help solidify such a story. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1999/

Subject: Lunch on your own (Friday)
Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2096/
Location: See printed schedule for room information

Subject: Media lawyers brown bag
Description: Does your investigation contain complex legal questions? Unsure of how to proceed? During the media lawyers brown bag, between 12:45 and 2 p.m. on Friday, June 5, bring your lunch and your questions for a personal discussion with some prominent media law experts that will be presenting throughout the 2015 IRE Conference. We'll provide drinks and dessert. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2093/

Subject: Interviewing liars
Description: Speakers: Matt Apuzzo, Don Borelli, Barry McManus - An investigative reporter, a former CIA polygraphist, and an FBI counterterrorism agent give you the tools you need for any interview. Learn how the FBI prepares for an interview and how intelligence professionals build rapport with people who have no incentive to talk. How can you tell when you're being lied to? How should you respond when it happens? And find out how to keep people talking, even when they know they should not. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1990/

Subject: Get the Sqoop: An easier way to search and set alerts for public records information (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Bill Hankes | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2002/

Subject: Writing master class: "Before the Law"
Description: Speakers: Jennifer Gonnerman, Stephen Engelberg - **Moderated by Stephen Engelberg, ProPublica | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1945/

Subject: Investigating the investigators: Digging into regulatory agencies
Description: Speakers: Howard Berkes, Tom Frank, Jay LaMonica, Doug Pardue - From bedrooms to airplanes to coal mines, investigators and regulators are supposed to enforce and protect. This panel looks at what happens when investigators don’t do their jobs and investigative reporters step in. Panelists will discuss investigations into the failures of police and courts to protect victims of domestic violence, and the failures of federal regulators to overcome conflicts of interest and regulatory weakness in response to coal mine hazards and crashes of small planes. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2101/

Subject: Funding the independent investigation (Sponsored by Fund for Investigative Journalism)
Description: Speakers: Esther Kaplan, Jane Sasseen, Ricardo Sandoval-Palos, Jon Sawyer, Laird Townsend, Brant Houston - **Moderated by Brant Houston, University of Illinois | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1978/

Subject: Covering the economics of medicine (Sponsored by Bloomberg)
Description: Speakers: Dean Baker, David Cay Johnston, Alicia Mundy - With healthcare costing 17.4 percent of the economy, knowing who gets the money, why we spend twice the average of other rich countries and how to think about cost issues can be valuable in identifying stories. Two journalists who have long reported on health care economics and an economist who has written extensively on how patent law and trade policies drive up health care costs will show you the data and suggest ways to think about the issues. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1967/

Subject: Broadcast deep dives 2
Description: Speakers: Vicky Nguyen, Liz Wagner, Jim Strickland, Tisha Thompson, Rick Yarborough - From undercover and interview techniques to research and records requests, watch some of the best investigative stories of the year and hear from the journalists behind the work. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2007/

Subject: 20 tools to fortify your social media
Description: Speakers: Doug Haddix - Whether you’re a social media novice or sophisticate, you’ll discover new tools and tactics with these proven apps and websites. Most are free or low cost. Tame Twitter with apps to help you find sources, uncover connections and mine posts. Discover ways to find social posts by location to target specific neighborhoods or communities for sources and information. Learn about simple tools to make compelling charts, maps, and other visuals to make your posts more shareable and engaging. Find ways to manage the social media firehose with automated curation, scheduled posts and effective monitoring. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1932/

Subject: Cracking the political piggy bank: An introduction to campaign finance data (Sponsored by Rockefeller Brothers Fund)
Description: Speakers: Ben Wieder - Learn how to access and analyze federal and state campaign finance data to follow the money in your community. We’ll cover how to keep tabs on top donors to your local Congressmen and Senators, and how to track political action committees active in their races. You’ll work with data from the Federal Election Commission and learn about other resources available for tracking influence in federal and state elections. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2023/

Subject: Broadcast: Avoiding legal trouble
Description: Speakers: Steve Chung, Barbara Wall, Kathleen Johnston - **Moderated by Kathleen Johnston, independent journalist | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1956/

Subject: Getting started with R
Description: Speakers: Ryann Grochowski Jones - Add statistical heft to your reporting by using R, a free, powerful open-source programming language. This session will tackle the basics of R: importing data, installing packages, working with variables, and sorting and organizing your data.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2016/

Subject: Management track: Dodging the bullets - making your stories as error and libel free as possible
Description: Speakers: Fernando Diaz, Bill Marimow, Les Zaitz, Robin Fields - **Moderated by Robin Fields, ProPublica | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1969/

Subject: Using Fusion Tables
Description: Speakers: Joe Yerardi | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2024/

Subject: A case study in virtual reality: Creating an Ebola documentary (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Fergus Pitt | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1904/

Subject: The anatomy of a crisis: Tracking the records trail
Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2102/

Subject: The art of developing sources
Description: Speakers: Manny Garcia, James Polk, Bernice Yeung, Matt Goldberg - **Moderated by Matt Goldberg, NBC4 Los Angeles | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1934/

Subject: Covering threats against journalists overseas without leaving town
Description: Speakers: Courtney Mabeus, Dana Priest, Kamran Shafi - This session will cover the  methodology used to research individual journalists imprisoned overseas including the use of social media to find and interview the colleagues and families of prisoners. Both the methodology and the social media tools can be easily adapted to report on other subjects outside of the United States without leaving the country. This session, which includes the perspective of a formerly imprisoned reporter, also will address the reasons why every journalist should consider investigating issues of press freedom around the world. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1946/

Subject: Show & Tell (Friday - #4)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2068/

Subject: Broadcast: How some of the best work gets done
Description: Speakers: Joel Grover, Brian Ross, Phil Williams | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1958/

Subject: Prisons, jails and punishment: The real story (Sponsored by Criminal Justice Journalists)
Description: Speakers: Julie Brown, David Rudovsky, Eileen Sullivan, Ted Gest | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1980/

Subject: Stonewalled: Strategies for getting what you need out of government
Description: Speakers: Rob Barry, Walt Bogdanich, Carol Leonnig, Charles Lewis - **Moderated by Charles Lewis, Investigative Reporting Workshop | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1992/

Subject: More with R
Description: Speakers: Coulter Jones | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2018/

Subject: SHOWCASE PANEL: The New Muckrakers - The expanding world of investigative journalism
Description: Speakers: Shani Hilton, Bill Keller, Jason Mojica, Betsy Reed, Andy Donohue - **Moderated by Andy Donohue, Reveal/CIR | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1994/

Subject: Broadcast: Your presentation style
Description: Speakers: Barry Nash - The Coaching Company Founder and Head Coach, Barry Nash, will talk about the challenge of addressing an audience you can neither see nor hear, the subtle and not-so-subtle ways it can compromise your message, and what to do about it.  He’ll share related research and load you up with practical tips on how to dress, move and talk so that viewers are more likely to “get” your stories, and your stories are more likely to get the attention they deserve. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1960/

Subject: Cleaning data with regular expressions and more
Description: Speakers: Agustin Armendariz | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2025/

Subject: Show & Tell (Friday - #5)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2069/

Subject: Working with whistleblowers
Description: Speakers: Scott Bronstein, Steve Riley, Dennis Wagner, Sarah Cohen - **Moderated by Sarah Cohen, The New York Times | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2105/

Subject: Finding the story: Contracts
Description: Speakers: Danielle Ivory | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2019/

Subject: Examining voter access issues (Sponsored by Rockefeller Brothers Fund)
Description: Speakers: Ari Berman, Paul Overberg, Myrna Perez | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2103/

Subject: Tools for transparency from the Sunlight Foundation (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Bill Allison, Jacob Fenton, Robert Lannon, Ryan Sibley - See first hand new and improved tools, and get a preview of coming attractions from the Sunlight Foundation. We'll demo tools that can help you research people, follow all the money sluicing through the electoral system -- whether its lobbyists working legislators or dark money groups taking to the airwaves, learn the latest about criminal justice data, and more.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2005/

Subject: Oil on the tracks: Covering the explosive story of crude trains (Sponsored by Society of Environmental Journalists)
Description: Speakers: Russell Gold - **Moderated by Russell Gold, The Wall Street Journal | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2104/

Description: Speakers: Aaron Diamant, John Ferrugia, David Raziq | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1970/

Description: Speakers: Paul Cheung, Benjamin Herold, Giannina Segnini, Erika Owens - **Moderated by Erika Owens, Knight-Mozilla OpenNews | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1982/

Subject: IRE Conference Registration (Saturday)
Description: Registration will be located on the 4th floor of the Philadelphia Marriott Downtown.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2088/

Subject: IRE Sales Table (Saturday)
Description: Stop by the IRE sales table and take a look at our merchandise. We will be selling books, the large selection of titles we carry will certainly include your interests. All proceeds from your purchase help support IRE and its mission.  Sales will be located on the 4th floor of the Philadelphia Marriott Downtown. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2091/

Subject: Web scraping for anyone
Description: Speakers: Samantha Sunne | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2035/

Subject: Broadcast: Breaking news investigations
Description: Speakers: Megan Chuchmach, Jodie Fleischer, Scott MacFarlane | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1935/

Subject: From the newsroom to the classroom
Description: Speakers: Rosemary Armao, Cheryl Phillips, James F McGinnis, Dawn Fallik - **Moderated by Dawn Fallik, University of Delaware | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1933/

Subject: Social media innovations: Investigative reporting and social documentary photography
Description: Speakers: Nina Berman, Jeff Kelly Lowenstein - Documentary photographers and investigative journalists often come together at the end of a long-term project, but this session will explore what happens when photographers and investigative reporters are in active and ongoing collaboration, particularly in the social media arena. The panel will show multiple examples of how photographers and investigative journalists can use the Instagram platform, and others, to build deeper and wider engagement, reach a national and international audiences and build new sources and story ledes. It is open to all people interested in investigative journalism, photography and your work having the widest possible audience and impact.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1895/

Subject: On the beat: Healthcare
Description: Speakers: JoNel Aleccia, Joanne Faryon, Christopher Weaver, Alison Young - **Moderated by Alison Young, USA TODAY | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2115/

Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2080/

Subject: Investigating what we eat
Description: Speakers: Mike McGraw, Duff Wilson, Bernice Yeung, Rose Ciotta - Pesticides, hormones, antibiotics, bacteria and inadequate inspections have turned food into a hot subject for investigation. This panel will cover how to get behind hype and government stonewalling to report on food safety  in an era of global trade. Topics include labeling and what consumers need to know. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1912/

Subject: Intro to mapping with QGIS: Importing and displaying data
Description: Speakers: Alexandra Kanik | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2044/

Subject: Using SQL to interrogate data (part 1)
Description: Speakers: Malik Singleton | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2050/

Subject: Beacon (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Adrian Sanders | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1942/

Subject: More with QGIS: Basic geographic analysis
Description: Speakers: Alex Richards - In this class we’ll tackle a project to join tables of data together with existing shapefiles and process data consisting of hundreds or thousands of points to give a more meaningful summary display. We’ll also cover some of the fundamentals of editing geographic data and saving it in web-ready formats.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2045/

Subject: Data visualization for reporting (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Kate Golden, Jaeah Lee | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1955/

Subject: How to become an instant expert on a topic through Google
Description: Speakers: Daniel Russell - It's happened to you--you need to do a story on a topic that's completely outside of your experience. Surely there's someone more qualified? The answer is usually NO. Now what? Now you have to come up to speed on that topic ASAP. In this mini-course, you’ll learn strategies and tactics to use to learn a domain as rapidly as possible. You won't be an expert, but you'll have a bunch of tips and methods to get to competence quickly. You won’t learn to pass the PhD exam in quantum physics, but a little knowledge about learning and Google search strategies can get you through that story. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1952/

Subject: Using SQL to interrogate data (part 2)
Description: Speakers: Meghan Hoyer | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2051/

Subject: Investigating black boxes
Description: Speakers: Julia Angwin, Reg Chua, Nicholas Diakopoulos, Jeremy Singer-Vine - Algorithms increasingly dominate our lives - influencing what information we find, where police are deployed, how stocks are priced, what we're charged for goods. Yet the public's understanding - and media coverage - of these new gatekeepers is still in its infancy. How should and can we be investigating these black boxes, and what are the technical, journalistic and legal challenges involved?   | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1947/

Subject: Show & Tell (Saturday - #2)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2071/

Subject: Advanced Excel functions
Description: Speakers: Aaron Kessler | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2036/

Subject: Buying influence: How to track lobbyists (Sponsored by Rockefeller Brothers Fund)
Description: Speakers: Sandra Fish, James Grimaldi, Eric Lipton - Federal law requires lobbyists to register with Congress. But that registration is just a tip sheet of sorts to getting a full picture of how various corporations are attempting to move their agendas in Washington--or in state capitols where they might also register a lobbying team. We take a look at some of the tools and techniques to build out a fuller, more narrative picture of what lobbying looks like by tapping into various databases, websites and other spots. We also discuss how states require a varying level of reporting, from basic registration to disclosure of payments from clients and contributions to lawmakers. And we reverse engineer a few stories--to show how the information needed to get a lobbying story on page one came together. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1950/

Subject: Investigating the military
Description: Speakers: Mark Greenblatt, Eva Parks, Mary Walsh | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1948/

Subject: Audio class with Reveal 2 (pre-registered attendees only)
Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2122/

Subject: The divide: Race, economics and law enforcement (Sponsored by Temple University School of Media and Communication)
Description: Speakers: Nikole Hannah-Jones, Kimbriell Kelly, Frances Robles | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1944/

Subject: Broadcast: 60 stories in 60 minutes
Description: Speakers: Nicole Vap, Lee Zurik - This may be the one panel where you will get stories you can take back to your newsroom and get started on the day you get back from IRE. These 60 stories from broadcast investigative reporters around the country will give you story ideas that will keep you busy until the IRE conference in 2016. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1949/

Subject: Pick & choose environmental investigations (Sponsored by Society of Environmental Journalists)
Description: Speakers: Joseph Davis, Robert McClure, Andrea Rodgers, Naveena Sadasivam, Jeff Burnside - **Moderated by Jeff Burnside, KOMO-Seattle | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1957/

Subject: Broadcast: Story structure
Description: Speakers: Solly Granatstein, Brendan Keefe, Chris Vanderveen, Matt Goldberg - **Moderated by Matt Goldberg, NBC4 Los Angeles | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1962/

Subject: Show & Tell (Saturday - #3)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2073/

Subject: Map like a pro with ArcGIS online
Description: Speakers: Robby Deming, Brian Peterson - We all live in a realm of data. But sometimes, spreadsheets and databases aren't the best way to tell your story. Take a hands-on tour of the redesigned ArcGIS Online to see how you can easily create intelligent maps in minutes. Learn how the new Smart Mapping feature in ArcGIS Online can help you investigate patterns in your data and easily create beautiful data visualizations, even if you've never worked with maps or GIS before. If you can use an Internet browser, you can create award-winning maps. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2046/

Subject: Doing investigations with students
Description: Speakers: David Armstrong, Sheila Coronel, Julia Harte, Joanna Zuckerman Bernstein, Brant Houston - **Moderated by Brant Houston, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1959/

Description: Speakers: Griff Palmer | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2052/

Description: Speakers: Laura Poitras, Robert Cribb - **Moderated by Robert Cribb, Toronto Star | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1964/

Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2123/

Subject: Navigating the publishing world: From ebooks to your first novel
Description: Speakers: Daniel Connolly, Kirsten Danis, Nancy Stancill, Jim MacMillan - **Moderated by Jim MacMillan, Temple University | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1966/

Subject: Reporting and tracking with Storify (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Doug Haddix - Explore a new way of using Storify -- as a private gathering place for your social media reporting and tracking. Learn how to set up private drafts in Storify as an efficient way of searching and saving social media posts from Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Tumblr and other platforms. Organize by beat or sources. Turn Storify into your own personal social media reporter's notebook. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1968/

Subject: Management track: Balancing enterprise with everything else
Description: Speakers: Gabriel Escobar, Kevin Merida, Richard Wiens, Kate Marymont - **Moderated by Kate Marymont, Gannett Company, Inc. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1961/

Subject: Liberating data from PDFs
Description: Speakers: Grant Smith | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2037/

Subject: IRE Awards Luncheon featuring keynote speaker James Risen of The New York Times
Description: A highlight of the IRE conference, the IRE Awards Luncheon begins at noon on Saturday in Salon A-F. We will present the 2014 IRE Awards and salute some of the best investigative work of the past year. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2094/

Subject: Doing stats in Excel
Description: Speakers: David Donald - You're comfortable doing data analysis in spreadsheets for your stories but would like to take your data journalism skills to the next level. This session introduces using statistics for stories through the comfort of Microsoft Excel. It will cover a more systematic way of thinking about your approach to your data and then applying your new understanding through descriptive statistics and regression analysis with an emphasis on storytelling. Familiarity with spreadsheets is necessary but no experience with statistics is assumed. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2047/

Subject: Broadcast deep dives 3
Description: Speakers: Gio Benitez, Jeremy Finley, Jenna Susko - From undercover and interview techniques to research and records requests, watch some of the best investigative stories of the year and hear from the journalists behind the work. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2072/

Subject: Tell me a (data) story I won't forget
Description: Speakers: Bill Dedman, T. Christian Miller, Dylan Purcell, Jennifer LaFleur - **Moderated by Jennifer LaFleur, The Center for Investigative Reporting/Reveal | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1983/

Subject: Creating a document state of mind
Description: Speakers: Mike McGraw, James Steele, Joe Stephens | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1979/

Subject: Campus coverage: Examining the cost of a college education (Sponsored by Lumina Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Kim Clark, Robert Kelchen, Jonah Newman | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1973/

Description: Speakers: Kavya Sukumar | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2038/

Subject: From words to pictures: Text analysis and visualization (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Nicholas Diakopoulos - You've got a massive pile of text: Some Ferguson tweets, a box of now OCRed documents, or maybe a corpus of press releases you scraped. How do you make sense of it? In this session I'll introduce some alternatives for using text visualization to see your texts in different ways. Then I'll talk about some of the machinery for text analysis that you'll need to get there, with pointers out to Python tools. Next year you'll be visualizing the SOTU like a pro. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1985/

Subject: An introduction to Python (part 1)
Description: Speakers: Tom Meagher | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2053/

Subject: Beyond words: Storytelling at the intersection of cool & creative
Description: Speakers: Gabriel Dance, Amy Julia Harris, Tori Marlan, Ken Armstrong - **Moderated by Ken Armstrong, The Marshall Project | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1981/

Subject: Broadcast: Hitting the ground running - new market, new beat
Description: Speakers: Danielle Leigh, Wendy Saltzman, Mc Nelly Torres - Many people switch jobs, switch beats, or have to learn a new medium. This panel will give tips on how to hit the ground running with stories and ideas as soon as you start. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1977/

Subject: Immigration: What part of "illegal" don't you understand? (Sponsored by Criminal Justice Journalists)
Description: Speakers: Cindy Carcamo, Lawrence Downes, Maria Sacchetti, Michael Matza - **Moderated by Michael Matza, The Philadelphia Inquirer | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1975/

Description: Speakers: Lois Norder, Mark Rochester, George Stanley, Robert Rosenthal - **Moderated by Robert Rosenthal, Reveal/CIR | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1971/

Description: Speakers: Walt Bogdanich, Duane Pohlman, Samantha Sunne, Frank LoMonte - **Moderated by Frank LoMonte, Student Press Law Center | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1995/

Subject: Avoiding prying eyes
Description: Speakers: Julia Angwin, Jack Gillum, Trish Wilson, Jesse Holcomb - **Moderated by Jesse Holcomb, Pew Research Center | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2030/

Subject: Free tools to get the job done (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Matt Carroll, Adam Schweigert | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1997/

Subject: Reporting on diverse communities that aren't your own (Sponsored by Asian American Journalists Association)
Description: Speakers: Sheila Coronel, Michael Matza, Sabrina Vourvoulias, Sherry Yu - What are the challenges journalists face when covering diverse communities that are not their own? Barriers of language and access can hinder deeper reporting, and thorny issues around race and cultures can offend readers and harm their subjects. Panelists will not only explore why more and better stories about underrepresented or marginalized groups is valuable and necessary for news organizations, but provide journalists with insights and methods for how to improve their reporting on people and places that newsrooms often fail to cover.  | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1993/

Subject: Geocoding: Turning addresses into locations
Description: Speakers: Liz Lucas - Have you ever received data that included addresses? In this session we'll talk about when it helps to display those addresses on a map, and show you how to do it using the Census Bureau's free online geocoder. We'll also talk about other free (or cheap) geocoding services and discuss checking for accuracy and avoiding potential traps and pitfalls. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2039/

Subject: Investigating law enforcement
Description: Speakers: Eric Flack, Jeremy Rogalski, Stephen Stock | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/1987/

Subject: Under pressure: Real life in real time with breaking news (repeat session)
Description: Speakers: Stephen Stock | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2048/

Subject: Show & Tell (Saturday - #4)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2074/

Subject: An introduction to Python (part 2)
Description: Speakers: Tom Meagher | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2054/

Subject: Show & Tell (Saturday - #5)
Description: Show & Tell sessions allow you to share your investigations with colleagues from around the country. Veteran broadcasters will moderate each session. Each slot runs for 10 minutes and includes a 5-minute break. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2075/

Subject: Broadcast: Hidden cameras
Description: Speakers: Josh Davis, Joe Ellis, Kevin Nious - Award winning producers from local and national broadcast news outlets discuss strategies for planning and executing undercover investigations. Learn best practices and see examples of ways to covertly use affordable consumer grade cameras and professional hidden cameras. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2000/

Subject: Finding the story: Public debt
Description: Speakers: Cezary Podkul | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2049/

Subject: Investigations with DocumentCloud
Description: Speakers: Anthony DeBarros, Ted Han - Learn how to make the most of DocumentCloud’s search, annotation, collaboration and publishing tools for your next investigation. Plus we’ll show great examples of DocumentCloud in action in recent investigative reports. This will be a focused hour of great examples of DocumentCloud in action and the particular pieces of the platform that investigations can make use of. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2040/

Subject: Pop-up panel (TBA #3)
Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2028/

Subject: Surviving PDFs: Tools and techniques (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Ryann Grochowski Jones, Tom Torok | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2006/

Subject: Data deep dives: Philip Meyer Award winners
Description: Speakers: David Donald, Michael Grabell, Ryan McNeill, Joseph Neff - **Moderated by Joseph Neff, The News & Observer | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2001/

Subject: Twitter tricks and analytics
Description: Speakers: Doug Haddix - If you know the basics of Twitter, you're ready to ratchet up your skills. This hands-on session will take you to the next level: advanced Twitter searches, mining tweets by location, creative uses of Twitter lists (public and private), and apps/services that provide robust analytics. The payoff: better sources (particularly during breaking news) and a competitive edge in your market. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2055/

Subject: Closing reception
Description: Join us for a closing reception from 7 - 8:15 p.m. and enjoy one last evening of catching up with old and new friends, speakers and colleagues.   | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2084/

Subject: IRE Sales Table (Sunday)
Description: Stop by the IRE sales table and take a look at our merchandise. We will be selling books, the large selection of titles we carry will certainly include your interests. All proceeds from your purchase help support IRE and its mission.  Sales will be located on the 4th floor of the Philadelphia Marriott Downtown. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2092/

Subject: Whose truth? Evaluate experts, recognize junk, tell better science & environmental stories
Description: Speakers: Elissa Yancey - Want to find new ways to make your audience hungry for science and environmental stories? Then come to a three-hour workshop that helps you sift through the science and the anti-science and gives you practical ideas to help you ramp up your science and environmental storytelling. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2111/

Subject: Data and docs
Description: Speakers: Megan Luther - Move beyond anecdotes and he-said, she-said journalism with data and documents. Advice on developing a documents state of mind, navigating public records, understanding records retention schedules, exploring key records on a variety of beats, and becoming familiar with key data sets to produce high-impact local stories. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2009/

Subject: Web scraping for anyone (repeat session)
Description: Speakers: Matt Wynn | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2056/

Subject: Get the IRE edge
Description: Speakers: Alex Richards, Lauren Grandestaff, Sarah Hutchins | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2113/

Subject: Advanced Excel functions (repeat session)
Description: Speakers: Liz Lucas | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2041/

Subject: The Web for investigators
Description: Speakers: Mark Horvit - What reporters and editors need to know. From better search techniques to the invisible Web, how to find documents and databases on deadline and where to find reliable websites for enterprise stories. The craft of better searching and not wasting time. Handling issues of credibility and ethics online. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2008/

Subject: Science journalism: Finding stories, choosing sources, sharing truth & other uncertainties
Description: Speakers: TBA | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2010/

Subject: Using hypotheses: The core of investigative method
Description: Speakers: Luuk Sengers - In Story-Based Inquiry, an investigation begins with a hypothesis. This is an answer to the question “What do you think that happened?” In this session participants will learn to explore possible story angles, and to rephrase them as concrete events that can be verified. Knowing what you are looking for increases your chances of discovering it. A hypothesis also makes it easier to co-operate in a team and to “sell” an idea to editors or clients. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2107/

Subject: Cleaning up data with OpenRefine (repeat session)
Description: Speakers: Denise Malan | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2057/

Subject: Finding the story: Workplace safety
Description: Speakers: Jaimi Dowdell | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2042/

Subject: Career roundtable
Description: Speakers: David Cay Johnston, Ellen Gabler, Manny Garcia, Josh Meyer, Jill Riepenhoff, Stephen Stock, Nicole Vap, Mark Horvit - **Moderated by Mark Horvit, IRE/NICAR | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2106/

Subject: Command line fundamentals for journalists
Description: Speakers: Alex Richards | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2058/

Subject: Liberating data from PDFs (repeat session)
Description: Speakers: David Herzog | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2043/

Subject: Investigating fraud
Description: Speakers: Roddy Boyd - Proving corporate fraud is usually the work of a judge and jury but the indicators of looming migraines, especially for publicly traded companies, are almost always found in "plain sight," within the public legal and financial filings. Armed with nearly unimpeachable source documents--i.e. what corporate executives have personally signed off on--your reporting on publicly traded companies can be instantly transformed into something much deeper and relevant. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2015/

Subject: Mastering timelines: The royal road to a successful project
Description: Speakers: Luuk Sengers - In Story-Based Inquiry, the hypothesis accounts for the principal event. But something must have happened first, to make that event possible. And after the event occurs, there will be further events and consequences. In this session participants will learn how to use their imaginations to construct a hypothetical chain of events (timeline or scenario), which can be used to guide investigators toward sources and documents with a high degree of accuracy. | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2108/

Subject: DocumentCloud: Examples and suggestions (Sponsored by Knight Foundation)
Description: Speakers: Ted Han, Anthony DeBarros | URL: http://ire.org/events-and-training/event/1574/2017/
